Archer, Francis C.

                Military records: Serial number: 3363325. Race: White. Residence: 1458 East 112th Street, Cleveland, Ohio. Enlistment division: Regular Army. Enlistment location, Columbus Barracks, Ohio. Enlistment date; 21 June 1918. Birth place: Woodsfield, Ohio. Age at time of enlistment: 19 5/12 years. Assignments: Battery B 1 Battalion Field Artillery Replacement Draft Cp Zachary Taylor Kentucky to 2 October 1918; 8 Battery October Automatic replacement draft Cp Zachary Taylor, Kentucky; 4 Battery Field Artillery Replacement Regiment Army Post Office 778 to 30 January 1918; 3 Battery Field Artillery Replacement Regiment Army Post office 778 to Discharge Private American Expeditionary Forces 26 October 1918 to 19 May 1919. Honorable discharge 28 May 1919.

                Social Security death index: Social Security Number: 279-09-1284. Last residence: 44035 Elyria, Lorain County, Ohio. Born: 3 January 1889. Died: 11 April 1983. Autopsy: yes - used for certification. Hispanic origin: Irish. Age 84 years.

 

Archer, Francis Kenneth

                Born: December 22, 1910, Woodsfield, Ohio. Father, William H. Archer Mother: Grace A. Dougherty. Source: Monroe County birth records.

 

Archer, Fred H.

                Fred H. Archer, age 54, well known Woodsfield resident, died suddenly Saturday morning at his home, 212 Eastern Avenue. He was born January 26, 1898, at Berne, Ohio, a son of Michael and Etta Thompson Archer, and was associated for many years with his father in the operation of Archers Feed Mill on Eastern Avenue. Lately he was connected with Flemings Hatchery of which he was manager. Mr. Archer is survived by his wife, Hildred; two sons, John Archer, of Woodsfield; two sisters, Miss Claire Archer and Miss Betty Archer, both of Woodsfield. His mother died July 18, 1943, and his father died March 25, 1949. A sister, Mrs. Zella Baughin, preceded him in death on March 5, 1932.

Funeral services will be held on Tuesday morning at nine oclock at St. Sylvesters Church, with the Rt. Reverend Msgr. J. G. Mehler officiating. Interment will be in Oaklawn cemetery. Friends are being received at the Schumacher Funeral Home. Source:The Monroe County Beacon, 1962.

 

Archer, Georgiana Rose

                Born: November 8, 1903, Lewisville, Ohio. Father: Edward Percell Archer. Mother: Theresa julia Raab. Source: Monroe County birth records.

 

Archer, Georgiana Stiers

                Georgiana was one of five in her graduating class of 1923 at Lewisville High School. Source: Lewisville, Ohio high school news.

Archer, Hulda Jane

                Born: December 20, 1846, Monroe County, Ohio. Died: February 26, 1863 in Wood County, West Virginia. Father: Michael M. Archer. Mother: Jane Buchanan. Married William Terry VanBuskirk. Born: Monroe County, OHio.

 

Archer, John Edward

                Born: January 27, 1918. Died: July 29, 1966, Lewisville, Ohio.

Father: Edward Percell Archer. Mother: Theresa Julia Raab. Source: Monroe County death records

                John Archer was one of 16 in his graduating class of 1936 at Lewisville High School. He participated in the Operetta at Lewisville.

Operetta At Lewisville

                The operetta Sylvia written by Maude Elizabeth Inch and W. Rhys-Herbert was presented by the Lewisville High School Choral Clubs before a large and appreciative audience on Wednesday evening, March 11, in the Lewisville High School auditorium. The competent cast included the following: Robert Vice, George Stewart, John Archer, Lloyd Bach, Edythe Young, Vivian Harper, Hazel Denbow, Ethel Cree, Wilma Geldmacher, Delilah Lumbatis and Wilda Seebach.

The operetta was given under the direction of Mr. R. E. Hilman, Music Director, assisted by Mrs. Robert DeVoe, pianist, Mr. L. H. Rebman, Miss Zelma Butt and Mr. Robert DeVoe. Instrumental music was furnished by the Lewisville High School Orchestra under the direction of Mr. Carl T. Moore.

Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, Thursday, March 12, 1936.

 

Archer, John Michael

                Born: May 28, 1928, Woodsfield, Ohio, parents: Frederick H. Archer and Hildred Magdalena Armbruster. Source: Monroe County birth records.

 

Archer, Joseph Anthony

                Born: November 8, 1910, Lewisville, Ohio, father: Edward Percell Archer, mother: Theresa Julia Raab. Source: Monroe County birth records.

 

Archer, Joseph and Mary Smith                                       

                The marriage of Miss Mary Smith and Joseph Archer was solemnized on Monday morning January fourteenth, 1952 at nine oclock in St. Pauls Catholic Church at Greencastle, Indiana. The bride is the granddaughter of Elmer Lighter, of Gosport, Indiana and the bridegroom is the son of Mrs. E. P. Archer, of Lewisville, Ohio. The Reverend Francis Kull officiated at the single ring ceremony before an altar decorated with vases of red Roses and lighted candles. The bride wore a smoke blue suit, with navy accessories and a corsage of White Roses. The attendants were Mrs. Kathleen Davis, of Crawfordsville, Indiana, cousin of the bride, and Maurie Carroll, friend of the bridegroom. Mr. Carroll and Mr. Archer were roommates during the war, when both were Air Force instructors at Paul Cox Field. Mrs. Davis wore a grey suit with black accessories and a corsage of pink Roses. Mrs. Archer is employed in the office of the Indiana Loan Company, at Greencastle, Indiana, and Mr. Archer is a 1928 graduate of Lewisville High School, Lewisville, Ohio and is the manager of Art Furniture Company, a branch of Barretts of Indianapolis, at Greencastle. Following the ceremony a wedding breakfast was held at the Paulama Tea Room for the immediate parties, their relatives and friends from Greencastle, Indianapolis and Spencer. After a short wedding trip, the newly married couple will reside on South Indiana Street, in Greencastle, Indiana.

Source:The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, January 1952.

                Joseph Archer was one of seven in his graduating class of 1928 at the Lewisville High School. He died in 1974.

Source: Lewisville, Ohio high school news.

Archer, Mrs. M. F.

                Mrs. M. F. Archer, aged 73, passed away at her home on Eastern Avenue, Sunday afternoon at 4:00 oclock, after an illness of several years. Surviving are her husband, two daughters, Misses Claire and Betty of the home; one son, Fred Archer, of Barnesville; three grandsons, William Archer, of the home; John Archer, of Barnesville, and William Baughin, of Akron. One daughter, Mrs. Zella Baughman, died several years ago. The body was taken to the Galbraith funeral home and will be taken to the late home this Monday afternoon. Funeral services will be held Tuesday morning at 10:00 oclock at St. Sylvesters Church with Reverend J. G. Mehler officiating. Burial will be made in Oaklawn cemetery, Woodsfield, Ohio. Source: The Monroe County Beacon.

 

Archer, Magdalene Philomena

Archer, Marcella Mary Burkhart  

                Marcella M. Burkhart, 73, of 419 South Main Street, Woodsfield, Ohio. Died Sunday in Noble County, Ohio. She was a member of St. Sylvester Catholic Church, Woodsfield. Surviving are three daughters, Mrs. Daniel (Sue Claare) O'Regan of Jersey City, New Jersey, Mrs. Charles (Patricia) Rousenberg of Tampa, Florida, and Mrs. John (Regina) Swarthout of Kansas; two sons, David of Chattanooga, Tennessee, and Larry of Woodsfield; a brother, John Archer of Green Castle, Indiana; four sisters, Mrs. Clotilda Wagner and Amelia Burkart both of Zanesville, Ohio, Madge Archer of Burbank, California, and Lucy Block of Lyle, Washington; 16 grandchildren; a great grandchild. Friends received at the Bauer-Turner Funeral home, Woodsfield, 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 pm Wednesday. Mass of Christian Burial at 10 AM Thursday in St. Sylvester Church, Woodsfield.

Interment in Church Cemetery. Rosary devotions at 8:30 PM. Wednesday. Source: The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, March 13, 1979.

                Marcella was one of two in her graduating class of 1924 at Lewisville High School. Source: Lewisville, Ohio high school news.

Archer, Sarah and John Carpenter, Jr.

Archer, Sebastian N.

                Sebastian N. Archer was born June 16, 1844, in what is now Noble County, near East Union. He was the son of Mr. and Mrs. Elijah Archer pioneer settlers on the East Fork of Duck Creek. The deceased was 78 years, 2 months, and 16 days old (died, September, 2, 1922). October 9, 1864, he was united in marriage to Miss Ellen McGovern at the Fulda Catholic church by Rev. Father Fluber. Immediately after the marriage Mr. Archer was called to serve his country in the Civil War. He was honorably discharged from the service at Camp Chase, Ohio, in the fall of 1865. Ten children were born to Mr. and Mrs. Archer, the oldest and youngest dying in infancy. His wife and eight children still survive: A. C. Archer of Zanesville, Ohio; U. W. of Somerset; E. P. Archer of Lewisville; A. J. Archer of Youngstown, and Thomas Archer of Columbus; Mrs. Thurman Smith of Caldwell; Rosa McEntee and Lucy Danford of the home. Mr. Archer is also survived by one brother, J. W. Archer of the home place and one sister, Mrs. Michael Crum of near East Union. Mr. Archer was honored and respected by all who knew him. He was a devout member of the Catholic church. His has been a Long and useful life and he has left to his sons and daughters no legacy more valuable than the example he set before them. May they always remember this in their different walks of life and may this be a guiding Star to steer them in the path of righteousness. The funeral was held at St. Sylvesters Catholic church at Woodsfield, Ohio, and he was laid to rest in the cemetery at that place, followed by a large concourse of relatives and friends among which was the local Grand Army Republic Post carrying the flag and flowers. May he rest in peace.

Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, September 14, 1922.

 

Archer, Stella

Source: Monroe County death records.

Archer, William F.

                William F. Archer, 77, Woodsfield, died April 20, 2004, at Ohio State University Hospital, Columbus. He was born in Woodsfield July 10, 1926, a son of the late Fredrick Archer and Hildred Armbruster Archer. He was a retired television repairman and a member of the St. Sylvester Catholic Church, Woodsfield. He is a grandson of M. F. Archer, owner of the Archer Mill that operated in Woodsfield for over 50 years. Surviving are several nieces and cousins. Friends were received April 22 at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, Woodsfield. Mass of Christian Burial was held April 23 at St. Sylvester Catholic Church, Woodsfield, with Reverend Father David Gaydosik officiating. Burial in the Oaklawn Cemetery, Woodsfield. Vigil service was held April 22 at the funeral home. Source: The Monroe County Beacon, Thursday, May 6, 2004.

Arman, Blanche Louella (nee Green)                            

          Mrs. Blanche Louella Arman, 85, of Powhatan, Route one, died Thursday evening, February 9, 1967, at seven oclock in Bellaire City Hospital.  She was born at Steinersville, Ohio, January 19, 1882, a daughter of the late George W. And Zella Bonar Green.  Mrs. Arman was a member of the Amity Methodist Church. Surviving are her husband, Harry Arman; one daughter, Miss Helen Arman, of the home; one brother, Newell Green, of Powhatan, and one sister, Mrs. Gladys Gillespie, of Jacobsburg.  Two brothers, Waldo and Alfred Green, preceded her in death. Brief services were held Monday afternoon at one oclock in the Gibson-Bauknecht Funeral Home, at Powhatan.  Additional services were held at 1:30 oclock at the Amity Methodist Church, with Evangelist Leonard officiating.  Burial was in Powhatan Cemetery.

Arman, James Alfred

                James Alfred Arman, died at the home of his brother, Francis Arman, at Proctor, West Virginia., on Thursday night, August 5, 1948. Funeral services were held at the Mason Funeral Home at Proctor on Sunday afternoon at 2:00 with Reverend M. C. Miles of the First Methodist Church of New Martinsville officiating. Burial was in the Abersold Cemetery. His wife, Lulu Gilmore Arman, died in 1918. Surviving are four sons, Herbert of Carrollton, Ohio; Harley of McCaysville, Georgia; Edward of Atlanta, Georgia; and Harold of Sardis, Ohio. Also surviving are two daughters, Hazel of Atlanta and Mrs. Thomas Redford of Benwood, West Virginia .; two brothers, Francis and Charlie of Proctor; one sister, Mrs. Frank Pegg of Viola, Illinois; 18 grandchildren and one great-grandchild. Source: Wetzel Democrat, New Martinsville, West Virginia, Thursday, August 12, 1948.

 

Armann, Susan

                Susan Armann, 52, of Taylor Street, Powhatan Point, Ohio, died Wednesday, December 29, 2004 in Belmont Community Hospital, Bellaire, Ohio. She was born December 22, 1952 in Bellaire, Ohio, a daughter of Rowland and Betty Scott Armann. She was a Methodist by faith. She was preceded in death by a sister, Barbara Kay Armann. Surviving in addition to her parents, residents of Powhatan Point are two daughters, Kelly Armann of Point Marion, Pennsylvania, and Tracy Armann (Jeremy Gruhlke) Powhatan Point, Ohio; four stepchildren: Sara Mick of Point Marion, Pennsylvania, Louie (Kathy) Palmer of Powhatan Point, Vickie Zack of Marianna, Pennsylvania, and Janice Moore of Indianapolis, Indiana; three brothers: George (Marie) Armann and Michael (Lori) Armann, all of Powhatan Point, James (Helen) Armann of Bellaire, Ohio; two sisters, Patsy (Donald) Meadows and Kathy (Louie) Palmer, all of Powhatan Point, Ohio; four grandchildren, several nieces, nephews, aunts and uncles. Friends received Thursday, 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m., at the Bauknecht-Altmeyer Funeral Homes and Crematory, 186 Main Street, Powhatan Point, Ohio, where services will be held at 1 p.m., Friday, with Pastor Donald J. Cordery officiating. Interment in Powhatan Cemetery, Powhatan Point, Ohio. Online condolences at www.altmeyer.com.

Source: The Times Leader,  Martins Ferry, Ohio. Published: December 30, 2004.

Armbruster, Helen F. Harp

                Barnesville  Mass of Christian burial will be 10:30 a.m. Saturday at Assumption Catholic Church, Barnesville, for Helen F. Harp, 79, of Barnesville, who died Monday (November 26, 2001) at Barnesville Health Care Center. The Reverend Father Virgil Reischman will officiate. Burial will be in Assumption Cemetery. Friends may call from 7 to 9 p.m. Friday at Campbell-Plumly-Milburn Funeral Home, Barnesville. Christian wake services will be 7 p.m. Friday at the funeral home. She was born November. 25, 1922, in Temperanceville, daughter of the late Fred and Mary (Teufel) Armbruster. Mrs. Harp was a member of Assumption Catholic Church. She was preceded in death by a brother, Bernard Armbruster; and four sisters, Kathryn Keller, Hildred Archer, Ileen Bragg and Marcella Armbruster. She leaves her husband, Clifford Harp; two sons, Steve Harp of Columbus and Kent Harp of Lewisville; a daughter, Mrs. August (Rita) Salvadori of Wheeling, W.Va.; three step-grandchildren; and six step-great-grandchildren.

Source: The Daily Jeffersonian, Cambridge, Ohio, November 2001.

 

Armbruster, Paul F.              

                Armbruster, Paul F., 55, a resident of Temperanceville, near Barnesville, was found dead Wednesday morning. He was born at Temperanceville on September 3, 1905, a son of George and Alice Armbruster. A veteran of World War II, he had been employed at Mansfield, Ohio, for several years. Surviving are one brother, George of Akron, and two sisters, Mrs. Norbert Flutterer and Mrs. Vinton J. Gehradt, both of Columbus. The body has been removed to the Campbell Funeral Home, Barnesville. Funeral services will not be held, but interment will be in Beaver Cemetery, near Calais.

Source: Wheeling News Register, Thursday, November 10, 1960.

 

Armstrong, A. D.

                 A. D. Armstrong, died 10-5-1871; formerly of Powhatten, where many relatives now live, and for many years was a clerk on the river, died in St. Louis; learned from dispatch received by Capt. Mulrine.

Source: Wheeling News Register, Wheeling, West Virginia, October 7, 1871.

 

Name: Mrs. Casper Riemenschneider, nee  Bertha Armstrong

Source: The Spirit of Democracy

Woodsfield, Ohio, Wednesday, April 30, 1930

 Mrs. Bertha Riemenschneider, wife of Casper Riemenschneider of Canton, Ohio, formerly of Woodsfield, died on Monday morning at her home. Death followed a paralytic stroke. Mrs. Francis L. Sulsberger of Woodsfield, is a daughter. Funeral services will be held at Canton on Thursday afternoon at 2:30.

 Mrs. Riemenschneider was 66 years of age and before her marriage was Miss Bertha Armstrong, a daughter of Ex-Commissioner and Mrs. James Armstrong. She was born and reared at Malaga and has a host of friends who are grieved to learn of her death.

 Besides the daughter above mentioned she is survived by her husband and one other daughter and a son, who are Mrs. Ray Brown and Darrell Riemenschneider.

Armstrong, Dorothy E. Covert

                Woodsfield, Ohio  Dorothy E. Covert, (nee Armstrong) 81, of Antioch, died Thursday (Sept. 27, 2001) at Barnesville Hospital. She was born July 30, 1920, in Holmes County, daughter of the late Elmer and Lola (Bogner) Armstrong. Mrs. Covert was a Protestant by faith. She was preceded in death by a son; three sisters; and a great-great-grandson. She leaves her husband, Kenneth Bud Covert of Antioch; three sons, Gene Vernon of Washington Court House, Glen Vernon of Atlanta, and Raymond Vernon of Atlanta; a nephew, Lloyd Smetzer of Wooster; a niece, Linda Wolbaugh of Apple Creek; several nieces and nephews; 11 grandchildren; two step-grandchildren; several great-grandchildren. Services will be 2 p.m. today at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, Woodsfield. Burial will be in Antioch Cemetery, Antioch.

Source: The Daily Jeffersonian, Cambridge, Ohio, September 2001.

Armstrong, Reverend John A.

                Reverend John A. Armstrong, 90, former pastor of Summerfield Christian Church, died recently at his home in Wellsville, following a long illness. He was a member of General Lyon Post No. 44, Grand Army of the Republic, which had a charter membership of 300 and now has three surviving members. He was chaplain of the Post at the time of his death. He was born in West Middletown, Pennsylvania in 1844, entered military service July, 1863, as a member of Co. K., 46th Pennsylvania regiment and was with General Sherman army at the close of the war and was discharged at Harrisburg, Pennsylvania. Three of his brothers also were Union Veterans. Reverend Armstrong served many charges as a minister until his retirement fifteen years ago. He leaves tow sons, J. C. and E. L. Armstrong of Wellsville, one brother and three grandchildren. Funeral services and interment took place at Wellsville. Reverend Armstrong will be remembered by many of the citizens of Summerfield and community.

Source: The Noble County Journal, Caldwell, Ohio, September 13, 1934.

Armstrong, Robert Joseph and Danna Lee Rubel

                Danna Lee Rubel and Robert Joseph Armstrong were united in marraige on October 12, at Trinity United Church of Christ, Lewisville. Reverend Denver Dodrill, uncle of the bridegroom, officiated at the double-ring ceremony. Parents of the couple are Mr. and Mrs. David Rubel, Woodsfield, and Mr. and Mrs. Robert A. Armstrong, Westerville. Grandparents are Lee and Betty Dunn, Sardis, and Dorcas Dodrill, Westerville. Attending the bride were Gayle Packer, maid of honor, and Tereca Rubel, matron of honor, Christina Rubel, sister-in-law of the bride, along with Julie Bradley and Rachel Weber, friends of the bride, as bridesmaids. Robert A. Armstrong was his son's best man. Kevin Meyers, Bill Bell, Kevin Frederick and Craig Meyers, friends of the bridegroom were groomsmen. Ring bearer was Jayce Rubel, the bride's nephew. Flower girls were Kia Birnbaum and Lucy Rubel, the bride's nieces. Adam and Weston Birnbaum , twin nephews of the bride, were ushers. Sue Vaughn, friend of the bride, was guest book attendant. Music was provided by Nancy Rubel, organist, Melissa Ceo, harpist and Lee Houtz, vocalist. A dinner reception was held at Rubel Park, Woodsfield. The bride is a graduate of Woodsfield High School and The Ohio State University and has a Masters of Science degree from the University of Kentucky. She is employed as Children's Services Manager at the Old Worthington Library, Worthington. The bridegrrom is a graduate of Westerville South High School and Toccoa Falls College, Toccoa, Georgia. He is employed as a network administrator with Grief Brothers Corporation, Delaware, Ohio. The couple honeymooned in the Smokey Mountains. They are currently residing in Worthington.

Source: Monroe County Beacon,  Woodsfield, Ohio, November 21, 2002.

Arn, E. W. and Clara C. McFarland

                E. W. Arn, age 30, of Monroe County. Parents: Felix and Sophia Schwing Arn. Married: December 11, 1907 to Clara C. McFarland. Age 18, of Monroe County. Daughter of George L. and Angeline Haley McFarland.

Source: Monroe County marriage records.

                  

Arn, Felix

                Mr. Felix Arn, an aged and highly respected citizen of this township, died very suddenly at his home west of town on Thursday evening, April 19th. (1917)                 He had been out in the field, plowing and harrowing during the forenoon. At noon he came in and put up the team for dinner. Failing to reach the house his daughter, Mrs. Emma Rea of Belmont, who was visiting her father, and was the only one of the family besides Mr. Arn, that was home at the time, went to look for him. She found him lying in the barnyard unconscious. She called a gentleman who was passing, and together they got him to the house and put him in bed where he remained unconscious until 8 or 9 o'clock in the evening when death claimed him. Cerebral hemorrhage is given as the cause of death. Mr. Arn had a paralytic stroke a few years ago, from which he never fully recovered. Deceased was born in Switzerland Township, this County, and was in his 75th year. He was a member of The Board of Trustees of Salem Township at the time of his death. He was a man of strict moral integrity, and held the confidence and esteem of the entire community. A number of grown children survive him. The funeral took place Sunday afternoon at 1 o'clock. Funeral services were conducted by Reverend Pugh, of Cameron M.E. Church. Interment in The Saint Jacobs Churchyard. Among those attending from a distance who attended the funeral were: Mrs. Emma Rea and Mr. and Mrs. Evans Bonar and son, Carl of Belmont; Mrs. Joe Arn and sister and Mr. and Mrs. Harry Wolff of Ellsworth, Ohio; Mr. L. E. Arn, of Mineral Ridge, Ohio. Clarington Independent, April 27, 1917. We extend sympathy to the relatives of the deceased. Mr. Arn and the writer were warm friends for more than fifty years and we much regretted to learn of his death.  Source:The Spirit of Democracy, Thursday, May 3, 1917.

 

Arn, John and Maria Elizabeth Roos

                Johannes John Arn was born May 23, 1804, in Niederbipp, Canton Bern, Switzerland. Parents: Ullrich and Anna Muller Arn. John died November 16, 1868. Aged: 64 years, 5 months, and 23 days. Spouse: Maria Elizabetha Roos Arn. Johannes emigrated to America in 1831.

Source: Monroe County emigration and death records.

John Arn married March 26, 1862 to Catherina Elizabeth Schoenhals. Born: September 22, 1843, Darmstedt, Hessen, Oberbreidenbach, Germany. Died: March 29, 1899, Atlantic, Cass County, Iowa. Buried: Atlantis, Cass County, Iowa.

Daughter of  Johannes Schoenhals and Anna Elizabeth Fink.

Arnett, Beulah Taylor Jahoples

                Pine Grove: Beulah Taylor Jahoples Arnett, 88, of New Martinsville, died Monday, June 21, 1999, at her home. She was born December 17, 1910, in Sutton, a daughter of the late Jack and Leatha Skidmore Carpenter. Her first husband, Ralph Taylor, second husband, John C. Jahoples, and her third husband, John Arnett, all preceded her in death. Surviving are three sons, Edward Taylor, New Martinsville, Phillip Taylor, Maryland, and George Jahoples, Georgia; six daughters, Ferrie Titus and Annabelle Corbin, both of Georgia, Eleanor Young, Graysville, Ohio, Phillis Glendening, Hannibal, Ohio, Christine Weaver, New Martinsville, and Georgia Heimbrod, Clarington, Ohio; 23 grandchildren and 34 great-grandchildren. She was also preceded in death by four sons, Ferrell F. Taylor, Berbie A. Taylor, James C. Jahoples and John Taylor.

Mrs. Arnett was a member of Fifth Street Church of God in New Martinsville. She was owner and operator at the former Preston Lunch in New Martinsville.

Source: Wetzel County Message Board, West Virginia. Published: June 1999

 

Arnold, Amanda

Arnold, Beth R. and Jason M. Hanes

                Harold and Karen Arnold of 15074 State Route 676, Waterford, announce the engagement of their daughter, Beth R. Arnold to Jason M. Hanes, son of Michael and Betty Hanes of 1195 Lynch Church Road, Marietta. The bride-to-be is the granddaughter of Herman and Leona Arnold, the late Hilda Arnold, Raymond Baker and the late Evelyn Baker, all of Waterford. She is a 2003 graduate of Marietta College with a bachelor's degree in early childhood education.She is employed as a substitute teacher. The prospective bridegroom is the grandson of Mary Hanes of Newport, the late Raymond Haynes, Geneva Brooks of New Matamoras, and the late Paul Brooks. He is a graduate of Washington State Community College with an associate's degree in heating, ventilation and air conditioning. He is employed by Wood Mechanical Services. The wedding is being planned for 2:30 p.m. December 18 at Saint John the Baptist Church in Churchtown. Custom of open church will be observed. A reception will follow at Saint John Central Grade School.

Source: Marietta Times, Marietta, Ohio. Published: October 16, 2004.

 

Arnold, Carl Lloyd and David Neal Christman              

                David Neal Christman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Clayton L. Christman, of Route 3, Woodsfield, and Carl Lloyd Arnold, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lloyd H. Arnold, of Route 1, Powhatan, who recently enlisted in the U.S. Navy, are now undergoing basic training at the U. S. Naval Training Center, Great Lakes, Illinois. After ten weeks of basic training they will be granted fourteen days leave before reporting to their next duty station. Published: May 1968.

Arnold,  Larissa Leah and Joshua Caleb Jones

                Mr. and Mrs. Tim Arnold of Beallsville have announced the engagement of their daughter, Larissa Leah Arnold to Joshua Caleb Jones, son of Mr. and Mrs. Keith Jones of Woodsfield. Miss Arnold graduated from Beallsville High School in 2001. She then completed Wheeling Hospital's School of Radiologic Technology and The Ohio State University Medical Center School of Radiation Therapy. She is a radiologic technologist in computed tomography and a Registered Radiation Therapist with Fairview Hospital in Cleveland. Jones graduated from Monroe Central High School in 1999 and attended The Ohio University. He is presently employed with Yoho Construction Company and has recently accepted their offer to operate and manage Miami Valley Palate Company in Medina. An October 9, 2004 wedding is planned. The couple will spend their honeymoon at Sanibel Island, Florida. They will reside in Westlake, Ohio.

Source: Monroe County Beacon, Published: Thursday,  July 29, 2004

Arnold, Matilda R. Blake.

                Matilda R. Blake,78, of 3125 East Pike Zanesville, formerly of Caldwell, died Wednesday, February 8, 1989 at Good Samaritan Medical Center following a lengthy illness. She was born November 10, 1910 in Noble County, daughter of Sebastian and Mary Ann Schafer Arnold. She was a member of Saint Stephen's Catholic Church in Caldwell. She was preceded in death by her husband, Harley Nicholas Blake, who died February 13, 1986. Mrs. Blake leaves one daughter, Mrs. Walter (Evelyn) Christman of Caldwell, Route 1; two sisters, Amelia Kimmell of Zanesville and Ida Crock of Reynoldsburg; two grandchildren and four great-grandchildren. Friends called from 7 to 9 p.m. Sunday at Hills Funeral Home in Zanesville. Services were held at 10:30 a.m. Monday at Saint Stephen's Catholic Church in Caldwell with Father Dale Tornes officiating. Burial was in Fulda Cemetery. Source: Journal Leader, Caldwell, Ohio.Published--February 13, 1989

 

Arnold, Sarah A. and Dennis W. Smith

                Married December 30, 1875. Source: Monroe County marriage records.

 

Mrs. D. W. Smith, nee Sarah Arnold

Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, Thursday, December 22, 1921

 Mrs. Sarah Smith, wife of D. W. Smith of Woodsfield, who has been in very poor health for several years past, died Friday evening at her home on South Main street, aged 61 years. She was a daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. James R. Arnold of Beallsville, but had been a resident of Woodsfield for may years. She was a member of the M. E.  church and the Eastern Star, and was regarded as one of the best members of each organization. She leaves beside her husband, two sons in Woodsfield, Alfred and Harry; one daughter, Mrs. W. K. Greenbank of Wooster and one son, D. Frank Smith of Marietta, Ohio.

 The funeral took place Sunday afternoon and was largely attended. Interment in Oaklawn cemetery, Woodsfield.

Arthur, Mr. Robert and Miss Hortense Kremer                                             

                Miss Hortense Kremer, daughter of Attorney and Mrs. T. J. Kremer of Woodsfield, was married to Robert Arthur, of Akron, at New York City Saturday, April 19, 1930. The bride is a graduate of Ohio State University and was employed in teaching at Akron. Mr. Arthur has a fine position with The Ensign Advertising Company and they will reside at Larchmeont, near New York. Mrs. Arthur has many friends in Woodsfield who extend congratulations and good wishes. Source:The Spirit of Democracy, Wednesday., April 23, 1930.

 

Artis, Eliza and Levi Robbins

Artz, Herbert W.   

                Herbert W. Artz, 87, resident of rural Tiro, died Thursday, March 25, 2004, in Crestwood Care Center following an extended illness. Born (August 31, 1916) in rural Shelby, Richland County, he had been a Tiro resident the majority of his life. He was a self-employed farmer and was a truck driver with PPG Industries, retiring in 1980. Mr. Artz was a 1935 graduate of Tiro High School, had served on the Tiro school board for 12 years and the Crawford County school board for two years. He was a member of the United Methodist Church in Tiro. Herbert enjoyed his family, camping, woodworking and traveling. Survivors include his wife, Elsie I. (Melick) Artz; four daughters and three sons-in-law, Patricia and Lloyd Betts, Elsie A. Wechter, all of Tiro, Sandra and Don Neumann of Bucyrus and Linda and John Kaple, Jr. of Shelby; two sons and daughters-in-law, Leslie and Mary Artz of Willard and Larry and Bonnie Artz of Tiro; 21 grandchildren; 41 great-grandchildren; five great-great-grandchildren; and two sisters-in-law, Frances Artz of Mansfield and Thelma Cole of Shelby. In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by one brother, Richard Artz; one son, Jerry Artz; four grandchildren; and one son-in-law, Louis Wechter. Services will be at 10:30 a.m. Monday from the Tiro United Methodist Church. The Reverend Andrew Angel will officiate with interment in Greenlawn Cemetery, Plymouth. Friends may call from 3-8 p.m. Sunday at the Barkdull Funeral Home, Shelby. Memorial expressions may be made to Tiro United Methodist Church.

Source: The Bucyrus Telegraph Forum, Bucyrus, Ohio, March 2004.

 

Ash, Mrs. Belle Zora (nee Folger)

                Ash, Mrs. Belle Zora, was born September 1, 1865, at Calais, Ohio, Monroe County and departed this life on February 23, 1931. Age 65 years, five months and 22 days. She was a daughter of Mariah (Hobbs) Folger and Israel Folger. Her mother left her at the tender age of four with these words, "Take good care of my baby Israel, I will meet her in heaven." She moved from Ohio to Middlebourne, West Virginia. At 16 years of age she worked as a seamstress until her marriage to McClellan Chase Ash on August 20, 1890. They located at New Cumberland, West Virginia until 1901 when they moved to Riggins Run, Doddridge County, where she resided until her death. Seven children were born of this union: Earl N. Ash of Tulsa, Oklahoma; Rolly L. Ash, deceased; Mrs. Blanche Kemper at home; Mrs. Bessie Baker of Holland, New York: Mrs. Delia Robinson of Olean, New York; and two which died in infancy. Twelve grand-children survive besides the following brothers and sisters; Marion (Ned) Folger of Lawndale, Ohio; Mrs. Campa Reynolds of Wellsville, Ohio; Mrs. Jane Stephen of Middlebourne, Mrs. Della Ann Warner of Clarksburg, and one half-brother, Ollie Folger of Middlebourne. Mrs. Ash was a member of the Bethel Methodist Episcopal Church on Riggins Run. Funeral services were held in the M.E. Church at 2:00 Thursday afternoon, Reverend Paul Flanagan of the M.E. Church of Salem presiding, assisted by Reverend Butler, pastor of the Bethel M.E. Church. Funeral arrangements were under the direction of Mr. Spurgeon of Salem. Interment was made in The Ash Cemetery, Riggins Run.

Source: Doddridge, West Virginia, Published: 1931.

 

Ash, Charles A.

Asherman, Kenneth

Ashley, Billy R. and Miss Virginia Spence                                     

                Mr. and Mrs. Homer Spence, of Lewisville, Ohio are announcing the marriage of their only daughter, Virginia, to Sergeant Billy R. Ashley, son of Mr. and Mrs. Herman Ashley, of Belpre, Ohio. The Reverend Clarence E. Nesbith officiated at the ceremony in Wickline Methodist Church in Midwest City, Oklahoma, on Saturday evening October 14, 1950, at eight oclock. Mrs. Ashley is a graduate of Lewisville high school, class of 1949. Sergeant Ashley is a graduate of Belpre high school. He spent three years with the United States Army Air Corps, and is now stationed at Tinker Air Field Base in Oklahoma. He is a member of the Army Reserve. The newlyweds are living at Apartment C., 311 East Boeing Drive, Midwest City, Oklahoma.

Source: The Monroe County Beacon, October 1950.

 

Ashley, Bill R.

                Bill R. Ashley, 68, 34852 Ohio 78, Lewisville, died Wednesday, April 30, 1997 at his home. He was born September 11, 1928 in Ripley, West Virginia, a son of the late Herman T. and Nellie Argabrite Ashley. He was retired supervisor at the former Conalco Corp. in Hannibal, was an Army Air Corps veteran of World War II, an Air Force veteran of Korean War, attended Lewisville United Methodist Church and was past president of the board of the Monroe County Park District. Surviving are his wife, Virginia Ginny Spence Ashley; two daughters, Michelle Rose of Wooster and Lisa Jackson of Beallsville; a son, Michael Ashley of Hamptoa, Virginia; three sisters, Louise Foulton of Williamstown, West Virginia, Wanda Richardson of Louden, Tennessee and Peggy Stotlar of Scott Depot, West Virginia; four grandchildren. Friends will be received at the Watters Funeral Home, Woodsfield, today, 2 to 5 and 7 to 9 p.m. Services and burial will be held at the convenience of the family with Lorna Brownfield officiating. Memorial contributions may be made to the Lewisville United Methodist Church, Lewisville, Ohio 43754.  Source:The Monroe County Beacon.

 

Ashley, Ernest and Mary E. Gatchell

                Ernest Ashley, age 48, of Morrow County. Residence: Monroe County.

Parents: H. E. and Adaline Ashley. Married: September 23, 1916 to Mary E. Gatchell. Age: 32, widow, from Monroe County. Daughter of Alexander and Frances Woodford Harmon. Source: Monroe County marriage records.

 

Ashley, Michael Spence

                Woodsfield, Ohio - Michael Spence Ashley, 49, of 206 Center St. died at 3:15 a.m. Tuesday (January 7, 2003) at Ruby Memorial Hospital in Morgantown, West Virginia. He was born Oct. 9, 1953, in Marietta to Bill R. and Virginia Spence Ashley. He was a 1971 graduate of the former Skyvue High School near Graysville. He received a bachelor of arts degree from New York State University and an associate of arts degree from Allan Hancock College in Santa Maria, California. He was also a retired U.S. Air Force veteran, serving during the Vietnam War and Desert Storm. He was a former management consultant for Ashley Consulting in Woodsfield and was a Southern Baptist by faith. He is survived by one son, Keats M. Ashley of Newport News, Virginia; one daughter, Elizabeth M. Ashley of Newport News; his mother of Woodsfield; two sisters, Michelle Rose and her husband, David, of Wooster and Milisa Ashley Jackson of Woodsfield; two nieces, Christiana Seebach and Melissa Robbins; and one nephew, Samuel Jackson. Services and burial will be held at the convenience of the family. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m. Friday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield.

Source:The Marietta Times, Wednesday, January 8, 2003.

Athey, William Edward

                William Edward Athey, 83 of New Martinsville, died Thursday 26 March 1998 at the Wetzel County Hospital, New Martinsville. He was born 16 November 1914 in Centerville, Ohio, a son of the late William T. and Hattie McFarland Athey. He was a former electrician at PPG Industries and IBEW, past owner of A&B Television in New Martinsville. He was a founder of the West Virginia Archaeological Society, also a member of the Brooks Bird Club, Hoof and Mouth Hiking Club, AYAH Astronomy Club, and EAA. In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by one sister, Lois Dawson. Surviving are his wife, Gail Isaly Athey; one son, Gary Athey of Slidell, Louisana; one daughter, Shirley Mullett of New Martinsville; one brother, Robert Athey of PrOctoberor; one sister, Irene Haught of Armstrong Mills, Ohio; six grand-children; six great-grandchildren. Interment in Saint John's United Church of Christ Cemetery, Powhatan Point, Ohio.

Source: Wetzel County, West Virginia. Published: March 1998

Atkinson, John J.

                John J. Atkinson, aged 76 years, died at his home in Barnesville, October 9, 1917, after an illness of several months. Deceased formerly resided at Cameron, this county, and later at Woodsfield and is well known to many of our people. He served in the late Civil War. He leaves a widow and two daughters.

The funeral services will be held at his late home at two oclock this (Thursday) afternoon and interment will be made in Greenmount Cemetery.

Source:The Spirit of Democracy, Thursday, October 11, 1917.

Atzenhoefer, Herman H.

Atzenhofer, Forest

                Military records: Serial number: 3856532. Race: White. Residence: R.ual Free Delivery  eight, Box 48, Beallsville, Ohio. Enlistment division: National Army Enlistment location: Woodsfield, Ohio. Enlistment date: 04 September 1918.

Ault, Betty Lou (nee Gillogly)                             

                Betty Lou Ault, 72, of Cambridge, died Friday (July 16, 2004) at Cambridge Health and Rehabilitation Center. She was born January 7, 1932, in New Concord, daughter of the late Ross Gillogly and Irene Myers Gillogly. Mrs. Ault retired from the former March Electric Plant, where she served 29 years. She was a 1950 graduate of New Concord High School. She was a member of Stop Nine Church of Christ and Golden Sixties. She enjoyed writing poetry and was actively involved in Scouting. She collected owls and loved photography. She was preceded in death by two brothers, Ian and Jerry; and a sister, Jean Hogue. She leaves her husband, Bob Ault of Woodsfield, whom she married July 19, 1975; two sons, David (Mary) Clifton of Claysville and Chuck Clifton of Cambridge; two stepsons, Bradley (Sandy) Ault of Wasilla, Alaska, and Doug (Denise) Ault of Anchorage, Alaska; a foster son, Doug Hawkins of Columbus; two daughters, Mrs. Marty (Debbie) Price of Cambridge and Bunny Whittle of Claysville; a stepdaughter, Mrs. Steve (Marla) Miller of Ellenton, Florida; three sisters, Shirley McAvoy of Zanesville, Patricia Anderson of Kissimmee, Florida, and Mrs. Don (Mary) Hivaor of McConnelsville; a half-sister, Mrs. Dave (Connie) Ellenberg of Alabama; and a host of friends, including a special friend, Gleneda Powers. Friends may call from 2 to 5 and 7 to 9 p.m. Monday at Thorn-Black Funeral Home, Cambridge, where services will be 11 a.m. Tuesday. Burial will be in Guernsey Memory Gardens. Source: The Daily Jeffersonian, July 18, 2004 and the Monroe County Beacon, published on Thursday, July 22, 2004.

Mother: E. Vaness. Source: Monroe County birth records.

Ault, Charlotte A.

                Woodsfield, Ohio - Charlotte A. Ault, 56, of the Monroe County Care Center died Monday (January 5, 2004) at the center. She was born March 6, 1947, in Barnesville to Ronald T. and Ruth Conley Ault. She is survived by three sisters, Mrs. John (Janet) Haslam of Clarington, Shirley Pealer of Woodsfield and Mrs. Francis (Judy) Blackstone of Lewisville; one brother, Rick Smith and his wife, Kim, of Thornton, West Virginia; and several nieces and nephews. She was preceded in death by her parents; and one brother, Ronald L. "Dink" Ault.

Services are at 2 p.m. Friday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield with Pastor Fred Ricer, Jr. officiating. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield.                      Friends will be received from noon Friday until the time of service at the funeral home. Source: The Marietta Times, Wednesday, January 7, 2004.

Ault, Edna Faye (nee,Ady)

                Edna Fay (Ady) Ault, age 89 of Navarre died Sunday December 30, 2001 in Mercy Medical Center following a brief illness. Born January 23, 1912 in Cameron, Ohio to the late Alonzo and Alice Mobley. She was a member of the Massillon Church of Christ and was preceded in death by her first husband Oscar Ault on December 30, 1960, her second husband Floyd Ault in 1992, one daughter Mildred Ady, one son Donald Ady, one brother Alvie Mobley, one sister Lottie Mobley Riley, one granddaughter Dawn Ady and one great granddaughter Christina Harless. Survivors include her children and their spouses; Juanita and Walter Speicher, Irvin and Darlene Ady, Betty and Bill Melnick, Lester and Mary Ady, Shirley Ady, Fred and Margaret Ady, Brenda and Bill Jacobs, Robert and Gale Ady, her brother and sister in law Kenneth and Anna Mobley, and life long friend Bill Sanders. There are 28 grandchildren, 61 great grandchildren and 35 great great grandchildren also surviving. She is dearly loved by all. Funeral services will be conducted Thursday at 1:00 PM in the Reed Funeral Home with Lance Lindenberger officiating. Burial will be in East Unionlawn Cemetery, Navarre. Calling hours in the funeral home Wednesday 7-9 PM. In lieu of flowers donations may be made to the family to help with final expenses.

Source: Reed Memorial Obituaries, Canton, Ohio. Published: January 2002.

 

Ault, Eleanor Jean

                Woodsfield, Ohio-Eleanor Jean Ault, 68, of Woodsfield, died Thursday (July 22, 2004) at Wake Forest University Baptist Medical Center, Winston-Salem, North Carolina, following injuries received in an automobile accident.

                Arrangements are pending at Watters Funeral home, Woodsfield, Ohio.

Source:The Daily Jeffersonian, Cambridge, Ohio, Sunday, July 25, 2004.

 

Ault, Eleanor Jean (nee Kibble)       

                Woodsfield, Ohio - Eleanor Jean Kibble Ault, 68, of Woodsfield died Thursday (July 22, 2004). There will be no visitation. Graveside services will be held at 3 p.m. Thursday at Cameron Cemetery in Cameron, Ohio. Arrangements are by Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield, Ohio.

Source of the above:The Marietta Times, Thursday, July 27, 2004.

                Eleanor Jean Ault, 68, 228 South Main Street, Woodsfield, died, July 22, 2004, in the Wake Forest University Baptist Medical Center, West Salem, North Carolina, following injuries received in an automobile accident. She was born at Sandyville, West Virginia, January 29, 1936, a daughter of the late Harry Chrisian and Mary Agnes Crow Kibble. She was a tax consultant for Ault's Accounting Service in Woodsfield, and was a member of the Bush Church of Christ, in Malaga. Surviving are her husband, Hilbert Lee Ault, whom she married December 28, 1952; three daughters, Deborah Kay Jones, of Cameron, Ohio, Denise Gail Harris of Woodsfield, Joyce Lea Helnick, of Columbus; brother, Harry J. Kibble of Parkersburg; nine grandchildren; 14 great-grandchildren. In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by an infant brother, infant sister and a sister, Ruby Helen Kibble. There was no visitation. Graveside services will be held July 29, at 3 p.m. at the Cameron Cemetery, Cameron with Minister Harry Summers officiating. Memorial contributions may be made to Search Television, Post Office Box 371, Edmund, Oklahoma 73083-0371 or to the World Bible School, Post Office Box 2169, 13441 Lime Creek Road, Cedar Park, Texas  78613. Arrangements by Watters Funeral Home, Woodsfield.

Source: The Monroe County Beacon, published, Thursday, July 29, 2004.

Ault, Leander Lee

                Lee Ault, aged 74 years and a highly respected citizen of Woodsfield passed away at his home near Eastern Avenue, Woodsfield, Tuesday afternoon, January 10, 1933, at 4:00. Death was due to influenza followed by pneumonia.

He is survived by his wife; two sons, Arthur of Eastern Avenue, and Clifford, of Columbus, Ohio; one daughter, Mrs. Bessie Dougherty; one sister, Mrs. Belle Naylor, of Jerusalem, Ohio and one brother Thomas Ault, of Jerusalem, besides many other relatives and friends who are sad to learn of his death. Funeral services will be held this Thursday afternoon at 3:00 oclock at the Woodsfield Church of Christ with Evangelist J. V. A. Traylor in charge. Interment will be made in Oaklawn Cemetery, Woodsfield.

Source:The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, Thursday, January 12, 1933

Ault, Rachel A. (nee Ady)   

                Woodsfield, Ohio - Rachel A. Ault, 99, of Woodsfield died Sunday (February 19, 1995) at the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center. She was born June 10, 1895, in Monroe County to William and Rebecca Palmer Ady. She was a member of Woodsfield Church of Christ. She was preceded in death by her husband, Stephen Ault, in 1951; two sons, Lester Ault, in 1940 and Floyd Ault in 1993; one daughter, Vera McConnell in 1982; one brother, Oscar Ady; three grandsons, Stephen, Virgil and Larry Ault; and one great grandson, Bruce McConnell. Mrs. Ault is survived by five sons, Ralph Ault. Stanley Ault, Clyde Ault and Chester Ault, all of Woodsfield, and Hilbert Ault of Barnesville; two daughters, Sylvia Jones and Erma Jones, both of Woodsfield; one sister, Ethel Grodhaus of Shadyside; 33 grandchildren; 78 great grandchildren and 30 great, great grandchildren. Services are 10 a.m. tomorrow at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home in Woodsfield with ministers Harry Summers, John Hamilton, Keith Jones and Richard Harris officiating. Burial is in Cameron Cemetery. Friends will be received at the funeral home from 2 to 9 p.m. today.

Source:The Monroe County Beacon, February 1995.

Ault, Ronald         

                Ronald Ault, 82, Canton, passed away in Columbus Mercy Medical Center, October 22, 1996. He was born in New Straightsville, Ohio, the son of the late John and Carrie Ault. He was a World War II veteran, a life member of the Veterans of Foreign War Post 3663, Buckhannon, West Virginia, and Church of Christ of Louisville, Ohio. He is survived by four daughters, Janet Haslem, Clarington, Ohio, Shirley Pealer, Woodsfield, Judy Blackstone, Lewisville, and Charlotte Ault, St. Clairsville, Ohio; two stepsons, Darrel Gates, Florida and Raymond Gates, Canton, Ohio; three stepdaughters, Sara Blackledge, Massillon, Ohio, Beulah Wolf, North Canton, Ohio, and Bernadine Blile, Louisville. He was preceded in death by his wife, Priscilla Mae Ault, December 22, 1994; one son, Ronald L.; stepchildren, Donna Jean Mills and Marvin Wayne Gates. Services were held October 26 in the Earl B. Jack Funeral Home. Burial in Sunset Hills Cemetery. Friends were received October 26.

Source:The Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, Thurs., October 31, 1996.

                Ruth K. Ault, 79, 501 Woodland Court, Woodsfield, died Sunday, January 18, 1998 at her home. She was born near Laings, May 18, 1918, a daughter of the late Con and Bessie Saffle Conley. She was a retired housekeeper and a member of the Woodsfield Church of Christ of Woodsfield. In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by a son, Ronald Lemoine Dink Ault; two brothers, Manford and Harold Conley. Surviving are four daughters, Janet Haslam, of Clarington, Shirley Pealer of Woodsfield, Judy K. Blackstone of Lewisville and Charlotte Ann Ault of St. Clairsville; a son, Rick Smith of Woodsfield; 12 grandchildren; several great grandchildren. Burial follows in Oaklawn Cemetery, Woodsfield.

                Woodsfield, Ohio - Stanley E. Ault, 79, of 45308 Ohio 78, Woodsfield, died at 10:15 a.m. Monday (December 17, 2001) at his home. He was born May 24, 1922, in Cameron, Ohio, to Stephen and Rachel Ady Ault. He was a retired farmer and a member of Woodsfield Church of Christ at Woodsfield. He is survived by his wife, Mary Yost Ault, whom he married Aug. 16, 1940; three daughters, Hattie King and her husband, David, of Laings, Ohio, Jacqueline Ridgeway of Massillon and Annet Ollom Keeton of Adena; one son, Rick S. Ulrich at home; four brothers, Ralph Ault and his wife, Naomi, Clyde Ault and his wife, Martha Lee, Hilbert Ault and his wife, Eleanor, and Chester Ault and his wife, Donna, all of Woodsfield; one sister, Sylvia Jones and her husband, Ralph, of Woodsfield; six grand-children, Mary Ann Campbell, April Crum, Savannah King, Gerald Ridgeway, Rachel Ridgeway and Elizabeth Keeton; five great-grandchildren, David King, Daniel Campbell, Ashley Campbell, Michael Crum and Walker Crum; and several nieces and nephews. Austin, Joseph C.

                Joseph C. Austin, Sr., 73, of Sardis, Ohio, died Wednesday, January 19, 2005 in the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center, Woodsfield, Ohio.

He was born in Fairview, West Virginia , the son of the late William E. and Lola Austin. In addition to his parents Joseph was preceded in death by his brother, William D. Austin and his sister Ruth Currey. He retired from the United States Army, attaining the rank of Sergeant First Class, and was a member of the Church of God in Lacey, Washington. Joseph is survived by his wife Dortha Austin of Lansing, Ohio; one son, Joseph C. Austin Jr. and his wife Kathy of Houston, Texas; two daughters, Victoria L. Austin, of Akron, Ohio, and Darla J. Austin, living at home; four brothers, Arthur Austin and his wife Margaret of Saint Clairsville, Ohio, Ray Austin and his wife Sylvia of Knoxville, Ohio, Gene Austin of Woodsfield, Ohio, Marion Austin and his wife Shirley of Lewisville, Ohio; three sisters, Vivian Whitlatch of Wheeling, West Virginia, Opal Emery of Ashland, Ohio, Nancy Miller and her husband James of Ashland, Ohio; four grandchildren, Sarah Dawn Jescoff of Houston, Texas, Rachel A. Austin of Lansing, Ohio, Katie and Adam of Houston, Texas; one great grandchild, Andrew Joseph Jescoff of Houston, Texas. Friends will be received Friday from 2-4 and 7-9 p.m. at the Altmeyer Funeral Home, 1400 Eoff Street, Wheeling, West Virginia , where services will be held at 11:00 am, Saturday January 22, 2005.Interment will follow at Big Run Cemetery, Cameron, West Virginia. Online condolences may be expressed to the family at www.altmeyer.com

Auten, Harry, Jr.

                Woodsfield, Ohio - Harry Auten, Jr., 83, of Ohio 26, Woodsfield, formerly of New Matamoras, died Friday (January 24, 2003) at the Monroe County Care Center in Woodsfield. He was born January 2, 1920, in Paden City, West Virginia, to Harry and Eva Barnhart Auten. He was a World War II veteran. He retired from Ormet Corp. at Hannibal, and was a member of New Matamoras Church of Christ. He is survived by his wife, Gaynell Deitch Auten; two daughters, Shirley Matz and her husband, Lewis W., of Woodsfield and Eva Kopnski and her husband, Mike, of Duck, North Carolina; six grandchildren; and 10 great-grandchildren. He was preceded in death by two brothers, Wilbert and Arthur Auten; four sisters, Goldie, Jeanette and Betty Auten and Virginia Smith. Services are at 1 p.m. Monday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul Street, Woodsfield, with Ministers Sam Bartrug and David Paher officiating. Burial is in Northview Cemetery in New Martinsville, West Virginia. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Sunday at the funeral home.

Source:The Marietta Times, Marietta, Ohio, Saturday, January 25, 2003.

Ayers, Carl Emerson, Sr.  

                Sardis, Ohio - Carl Emerson Ayers, Sr., 72, of Lakeview Drive, Sardis (Antioch community), died Monday (January 26, 2004) at Wetzel County Hospital in New Martinsville, West Virginia.

                He was born August 12, 1931, in Sycamore Valley, Ohio, to Isaac Ayers and Carrie Nalley Ayers. He was a retired 35-year employee of Ormet Corporation in Hannibal, Ohio, as a D.C. caster.

                He was a member of Pleasant Ridge Church of Christ, Eastern Star Lodge 268 of Woodsfield and Masonic Lodge 300 of Stafford. He was a 32nd Degree Mason. He was preceded in death by his first wife, Janet Marshall Ayers; one son, Leslie M. Ayers, Sr.; one brother, Harold Ayers; and one sister, Pearl Lindamood.

                He is survived by his wife, Rosalie Borman Ayers, whom he married on May 12, 1962; two sons, Lewis Ayers of Whipple, and Carl Ayers, Jr. and his wife, Lori, of Clarington; three daughters, Crystal Eikleberry and her husband, Russell, of Sardis, Peggy Winland and her husband, Tom, of Lewisville, and Tina McIntire and her husband, Preston, of Clarington; one sister, Dorothia Hall and her husband, Floyd, of Graysville; one brother, Melvin Ayers and his wife, Laura, of Sycamore Valley; one sister-in-law, Stella Ayers of Frazeysburg, Ohio; one brother-in-law, Ralph Lindamood of Massillon; 19 grandchildren; and 16 great-grandchildren.

                Services are at 1 p.m. Friday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home at 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with Tim Fleeman officiating. Burial is in Pleasant Ridge Cemetery at Graysville.

                Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Thursday at the funeral home, where Eastern Star lodge services will be held at 7 p.m. Thursday, followed by Masonic lodge services at 7:30 p.m.

Source: The Marietta Times, dated Wednesday, January 28, 2004.

 

Ayers, Carrie

                Born: November 3, 1898. Died: August 1984. Residence: Sycamore Valley

Source: Monroe County death records.

 

Ayers, Charles W.

                Belpre, Ohio- Charles W. Ayers, 86, a well noted worldwide tool and die maker of Belpre, passed away Friday (Feb. 4, 2005) at the Marietta Nursing and Rehabilitation Center. He was born Feb. 21, 1918 in Monroe County, Ohio, a son of the late Robert E. and Fay McFadden Ayers. Mr. Ayers was a U.S. Army veteran of World War II where he served as a PX officer in Japan. He was a lifetime charter member of the World War II Memorial, a 32nd Degree Mason, a Shriner and had received his 60 year pin from the Stafford Lodge Number 300 in Ohio. He was also a lifetime member of American Legion Post 888 in Columbus, Ohio. He was a member of the Belpre Church of Christ since 1968. Mr. Ayers retired from B.F. Goodrich in 1981 after 34 years service. He also had his own tool and die shop from 1949 until 1997. He is survived by his wife of 55 years, Phyllis Buckley Ayers; a sister, Evelyn Curione of Niagara Falls, N.Y.; a brother, Harry Ayers of Marietta; two brothers-in-law, Paul Buckley of Coolville and Howard Buckley of Marietta; one sister-in-law, Mary Helen Humphrey of Parkersburg; and several nieces and nephews. There will be no visitation. Burial in the Reedsville Cemetery will be at the convenience of the family. Arrangements have been entrusted to the Vaughan Funeral Home, Parkersburg. Source: Marietta Times, Saturday, February 5, 2005.

Ayers, Isaac

                Born: February 3, 1894. Died: November 10, 1980. Residence: Sycamore Valley. Autopsy: yes - used for certification. Married. Hispanic origin: British, Scotch-Irish, Welsh, Scottish. Place of death: Marietta, Washington County, Ohio. Age: 86 years. Source: Monroe County death records.

                Military records: Serial number: 2481877. Race: white. Residence: Sycamore Valley, Ohio. Enlistment division: National Army. Enlistment location: Woodsfield, Ohio. Enlistment date: 27 May 1918. Birth place; Sycamore Valley, Ohio. Birth date: 3 February 1894. Assignments: 24 Co 6 Training Battalion 158 Depot Brigade to 02 July 1918; Co A 334 Infantry to 6 October 1918; Co D 16 Infantry to 30 July 1919; Co C 16 Infantry to Discharge Private; Corporal 20 September 1918; Private 25 October 1918. Meuse-Argonne. American Expeditionary Forces 1 September 1918 to 5 September 1919. Honorable discharge: 24 September 1919.

Silver Star citation.

 

Ayers, Leslie M.

                Sycamore Valley, Ohio - Leslie M. Ayers, 42, of Ohio 260, Sycamore Valley, died Tuesday night (February 22, 1994) at his home.

                He was born June 16, 1951, at Zanesville to Carl E. Ayers, Sr., and Janet Pauline Marshall Ayers. He was a former employee of Pattin Manufacturing Company in Marietta and was a Vietnam Veteran.

                Mr. Ayers is survived by one son, Michael Ayers of home; one daughter, Betty Jo Allen of Lewisville; two brothers, Lewis Ayers of Whipple and Carl Ayers, Jr., of Antioch; three sisters, Crystal Eikleberry of Sardis, Peggy Winland of Sycamore Valley and Tina McIntire of Clarington and his father, Carl E. Ayers, Sr., and stepmother, Rosalie Ayers, both of Antioch. He was preceded in death by his mother.

                Services are 2 p.m. tomorrow at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home in Woodsfield with William Pickenpaugh officiating. Burial is in Pleasant Ridge Cemetery near Graysville with full military graveside services.

Friends will be received from 3 to 9 p.m. today at the funeral home.

Source: The Monroe County Beacon, February 1994.

 

Ayers, Sarah J.

                Died: December 14, 1927, Monroe County, Ohio. Volume number: 5524. Certificate number: 71496. Source: Monroe County death records.

 

Ayers, Stella D. Grannie (nee Hall)

                Frazeysburg, Ohio - Stella D. Grannie Ayers, 80, of Frazeysburg died at 10:05 p.m. on Friday (March 12, 2004) at her home.

                She was born March 23, 1923 in Graysville, Ohio to Harry E. and Mattie Bell (Mobberley) Hall. She retired in 1980 as a molder with The Ohio Plastics Company of Frazeysburg and she was a member of Meadow View Church of Christ in Frazeysburg.

                She is survived by one son, Chauncey (Brenda) Ayers of Chesapeake, Virginia; four daughters, Norma (Tad) Lupher of Warsaw, Ohio, Ruth (Bill) Harper of Frazeysburg, Dianne (Bill) Huston of Zanesville and Patti Nethers of Frazeysburg; one brother, Floyd (Dorothia) Hall of Graysville; four sisters, Leona Beardmore and Maxine Marshall, both of Marietta, and Lotie Scott and Clarice (Chester) Devore, both of Canton; brothers-in-law and sisters-in-law, Ralph (Marjorie) Lindamood of Massillon, Melvin (Laura) Ayers of Sycamore Valley, and Rosalie Ayers of Sardis; 22 grandchildren; 42 great-grandchildren; two great-great-grandchildren; several nieces and nephews; and her cat, Gracie. On June 17, 1939, she married Harold L. Ayers. He died on August 12, 1983.

                 She was also preceded in death by her parents; one son-in-law, George Nethers, on April 22, 2001; one brother, Mervin Hall; and two sisters, Grethel Gray and Martha Lee Hall.

                Services were conducted March 15 at Meadow View Church of Christ in Frazeysburg. Ministers Lyle Lipps and David Crist officiated. Burial was in Frazeysburg Cemetery. Vensil-Orr & Chute Funeral Home in Frazeysburg handled the arrangements.

                Memorial contributions may be made to Genesis Hospice, 713 Forest Avenue, Zanesville, Ohio 47301.

 

Ayers, William F. and Mollie G. Myers

                Married: January 1, 1899. Source: Monroe County marriage records.

 

Ayres, Florence E. and George F. Turner

                George F. Turner and Florence E. Ayres, age 16, were married April 17, 1879. Source: Monroe County marriage records.

 

Ayres, Mary E. and Allen Clark

                Married: December 24, 1878. Source: Monroe County marriage records.

Ayres, William J. and Ella M. Fowler

                Married: April 22, 1877. Source: Monroe County marriage records.

Monroe County, Ohio

Scrapbook

 

 

Volume: A

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

                                                                                                                               

                                                                                                                                Lena (Kahrig) Pettit

                                                                                                                                                                  2005

 

 

 

 

The Monroe County, Ohio

Scrapbook

 

 

 

 

 

This book of births, weddings, anniversaries, honors, and military service is the collection of my mother, Gertrude Christman Kahrig. She, along with her family and friends collected the articles that made this book possible. I do appreciate everyones help in this important project to preserve our County history.

 

The following articles were published between the years 1834-2005, and are reproduced here as published.

 

This first volume includes 143 self-indexed pages of surnames linked to Monroe County. This volume contains 85 surnames beginning with the letter A.

 

Abbott, Aberick, Aberigg, Abersold, Abicht, Ables, Abmyer, Abmyre, Abraham, Abrigg, Acker, Ackerman, Ackley, Adair, Adams, Adamson, Addis, Adie, Adkins, Ady, Aemmer, Affoltar, Agey, Agin, Agners, Ahrens, Aikman, Akers, Akins, Albanese, Albee, Albright, Albus, Aldeman, Alden, Alexander, Alford, Algeo, Allar, Alleman, Allen, Allendaffer, Allison, Alloway, Allshouse, Alltop, Althaus, Alvis, Alwine, Alzenhoefer, Amber, Ambler, Ambrose, Amos, Andears, Anderson, Andrews, Angus, Ankrom, Anshutz, Anthony, Antill, Antler, Archbold, Archer, Arman, Armbruster, Armstrong, Arn, Arnold, Arthur, Artz, Ash, Asherman, Ashley, Athey, Atkerson, Atkins, Atkinson, Atzenhofer, Ault, Austin, Auten, Avers, Axtell and Ayers.

 

 

 

                                                                                                                                                Lena Kahrig Pettit

                                                                                                                                                2005
